image.altText: A man with grey hair seated in parliament looks sad

props.synopsis: Chinks in Tasmania's minority government armour are appearing, as within the space of hours, The Greens and Labor passed two consecutive bills through the lower house against the government's wishes, both on issues that the Liberals have long held out on.

title.children: Tasmanian government loses control as opposition passes legislation

image.altText: A black shopping basket sitting on a kitchen bench that contains bread, mince, carrots, apples and milk.

props.synopsis: Australians have few options when it comes to saving on groceries at supermarket giants Coles and Woolworths, with a new report by Choice finding a price difference of just 75 cents between the two for the same basic items.

title.children: Average basket of groceries costs most in Tasmania, as Choice report highlights lack of Aldi

image.altText: a nuclear generating station can be seen with water infront of it.

props.synopsis: Coalition promises that nuclear power will make for cheaper electricity prices don't stack up, according to an energy analyst, who says there was no evidence anywhere in the developed world to suggest new reactors were pushing down prices.

title.children: 'An absolute stretch': Dutton's promise nuclear will make for cheaper power questioned

image.altText: A woman with black hair and a beige coat holds up her phone while winding through dense reeds and bushland at dusk.

props.synopsis: Nestled in dense bushland in Tasmania's north exists the state's oldest geocache. It's attracted hundreds of people globally in the search for it.

title.children: Christal is the latest in a decades-long list of worldwide hunters searching out Tasmania's oldest geocache

image.altText: Two men are shaking hands and holding folders while standing in front of country flags.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin has visited North Korea for the first time in 24 years, signing a new partnership that one expert has described as an anti-West coalition.

title.children: Concerns for the West as Russia and North Korea sign pact to protect one another

image.altText: Coalition politicians stand on the floor of the house of representatives.

props.synopsis: The Coalition could press on "in the national interest" to establish nuclear reactors in seven communities even if locals oppose it, despite previously suggesting it would only progress nuclear on the condition that host communities approve.

title.children: 'We believe it's in the community's interests': Dutton would not give locals nuclear veto

image.altText: RBA governor Michele Bullock at press conference

props.synopsis: Rate rise after rate rise should have sent the economy into a tailspin, but the RBA isn't fighting a textbook case of inflation.

title.children: What's driving our inflation? And would more rate rises fix the problems?

image.altText: Daniel Victor Gandini, wearing a three piece suit and peak cap, standing in the sunshine on the street in Burnie.

props.synopsis: A man representing himself while accused of assaulting his former partner and splashing acid on four police officers is challenged when he says he is going to leave court because the evidence is "too distressing".

title.children: 'You're not allowed to leave': 'Diplomat Dan' challenged in courtroom as pre-siege CCTV played

image.altText: Tasmania Police detective and forensics officers next to a police vehicle in a street.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian woman who was nearly killed by her ex-partner after he snuck into her house and stabbed her and her new partner says she wanted to get tattoos to cover up the scars but was told the skin was too damaged.

title.children: 'It won't break me. I won't allow that': 18yo opens up about night he intervened as his father stabbed his mum

image.altText: Fleur Connick at scenic restaurant on Cat Ba Island, Vietnam.

props.synopsis: The incidence of TB in Australia is low, but experts say we must remain alert to the disease, particularly with the growing threat of drug-resistant TB. This is what you need to know.

title.children: Doctors told me I'd be 'very unlucky' to have TB in Australia. A week later I tested positive

image.altText: A crowd watching a screen with a man in a turban on it.

props.synopsis: Hezbollah has accused Cyprus of allowing Israel to use its airports and bases for military exercises.

title.children: Head of Hezbollah tells Israel there will be no safe place in event of broader war, threatens Cyprus for first time

image.altText: Men in the water

props.synopsis: Parts of Queensland's Cape York Peninsula will today be elevated to the UNESCO World Heritage Tentative list, but experts warn what many regard a coup, could be a double-edged sword.

title.children: World Heritage coup for Cape York, but would an ultimate listing kill tourism or help it?

image.altText: A dachshund wearing a pink harness stands between a person's legs, looking to the left

props.synopsis: Pet ownership can offer a wealth of positives for many people, but for those experiencing homelessness, the costs can be insurmountable.

title.children: Poppy, Ash and Smiley all have one thing in common — alongside their owners, they are homeless

image.altText: Two hands hold cracked walnuts

props.synopsis: The wine glut in parts of Australia is not deterring developers from forging ahead with planting new vineyards in Tasmania.

title.children: Iconic walnut farm snapped up by major wine producer as cool climate grapes in demand

image.altText: A nuclear cooling plant with a bird flying in front of it.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton faces stiff opposition to his nuclear ambitions due to wall-to-wall Labor state governments, but figures it's simply a choice between the carrot or the stick.

title.children: Peter Dutton has announced the sites for proposed nuclear reactors. Here's what comes next

image.altText: Bruce Hodge

props.synopsis: Two NSW police officers are facing assault charges following a confrontation with 92-year-old Ronald Hogan at his Picton home after his wife, who has dementia, called triple-0. The couple's son is calling for aged care reform.

title.children: Son of elderly man allegedly assaulted by police says aged care system is 'overloaded'

image.altText: Office workers

props.synopsis: Women are paid 13.5 per cent less than men in the public sector and 21.7 per cent less in the private sector, according to the Workplace Gender Equality Agency scorecard.

title.children: There's a $19,000 pay gap between men and women who work in the public sector

image.altText: Chinese Coast Guards hold an axe as they approach Philippine troops on boats.

props.synopsis: The Philippine military says a Filipino sailor lost a thumb in a violent confrontation with the Chinese coast guard in the South China Sea.

title.children: Philippines accuses Chinese coast guard of 'piracy' after violent clash in South China Sea

image.altText: three women in colourful urban wear and black hijabs stand confidently against a black background.

props.synopsis: Voice of Baceprot are a devoutly Muslim all-female thrash metal band hell-bent on shattering the genre's masculine image and misconceptions about Islam.

title.children: Indonesian Muslim metal band Voice of Baceprot take peaceful brand of thrash metal to Glastonbury

image.altText: for lease sign with leased sticker

props.synopsis: A property lecturer says while the changes could lead to a more equitable quality of life, they also may lead to investors choosing to swap from long-term leases to short-term accommodation.

title.children: 'Leading with a stick': Victoria's stronger minimum rental standards raise concerns

image.altText: Charlise Mutten smiling holding two plush toys, next to her mother

props.synopsis: Justin Laurens Stein being found guilty of murdering nine-year-old Charlise Mutten has allowed for the release of dozens of files of evidence, including his police interviews and phone calls to his mother recorded in jail.

title.children: The evidence that led to the conviction of Charlise Mutten's killer

image.altText: A close up of the mouth of what looks like an eel, with rows of teeth

props.synopsis: The finding bucks the belief that lamprey fish live in cold climates and gives researchers hope the species could be resistant to climate change.

title.children: 'Vegan Dracula' fish excites scientists after discovery in Queensland waterways

image.altText: A composite image of a smart phone with ChatGPT on the screen and a hand holding a pen that is writing on paper.

props.synopsis: Students are central to an AI arms race in which programs generating answers for assignments and those designed to catch them out are scrambling for superiority.

title.children: Is using ChatGPT for an assignment cheating? It depends who you ask

image.altText: A pyramid shaped building with three flags out the front at half mast.

props.synopsis: All elected members of the Barkly Regional Council have been officially dismissed following an investigation into its management, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Entire NT outback council dismissed after investigation finds 'serious deficiencies'

image.altText: a woman in a grey jumper looking directly at the camera

props.synopsis: The Australian Human Rights Commission is handling a complaint lodged by a parent who alleges age discrimination occurred during an investigation into allegations made by her daughter.

title.children: Advocates hope complaint alleging age discrimination over young gymnast's bullying claims will help address 'power imbalances'

image.altText: A man in a blue morph suit controls an emu puppet in a large bush field

props.synopsis: The great emu war of 1932 is as baked into Australia lore as vegemite and chucking a sickie after a big weekend. A new film from some of our country's brightest comedy makers turns the tale into an ochre Apocalypse Now.

title.children: The Emu War is an absurd, chaotic delight featuring machine guns, puppets and Ned Kelly

image.altText: Rishi Sunak, wearing a suit, gestures with his hand.

props.synopsis: The date had been a closely guarded secret and the announcement took many people in Mr Sunak's governing Conservative Party by surprise.

title.children: One of Rishi Sunak's bodyguards arrested over alleged bets on UK election date

image.altText: Patty Mills celebrates with the bronze medal

props.synopsis: When Patty Mills led Australia's men's basketball team to its first Olympic medal ever in Tokyo, Andrew Gaze burst into tears. The basketball legend's legacy will be front and centre again as the Boomers attempt to go back-to-back in Paris.

title.children: 'He was Superman': Basketball icon's inspiration behind Boomers' push to make more Olympic history

image.altText: Two male tennis players meet at the net after a match, the one on the right in discomfort, the other showing sympathy

props.synopsis: Jordan Thompson has made it into the quarterfinals of the Queen's Club Championships but could take no pleasure from defeating home hero Andy Murray for the second time on one of the Briton's grass-court strongholds.

title.children: Two Aussies through to Queen's quarterfinals as Andy Murray bows out

image.altText: Giant panda Fu Ni

props.synopsis: While cuddly duo Wang Wang and Fu Ni will soon be set to return home to China, Adelaide Zoo is adamant that the pandas' love affair with the public has fulfilled predictions from prior to their arrival.

title.children: Australia's pandas may not have mated, but have enjoyed a love affair with the public

image.altText: A tower apartment complex getting built.

props.synopsis: Gosford's skyline is filled with cranes and rising buildings. But is the city ready for forecast exponential growth as the construction industry struggles to keep up with demand?

title.children: On the brink of flourishing or 'graveyard of dreams'? How Gosford is emerging as Sydney's satellite city

image.altText: Two coaches turn towards each other and look concerned as they chat tactics

props.synopsis: A former Diamonds coach urges the Queensland Firebirds to seriously think about filling Bec Bulley's role for the 2025 season with a more-experienced name over another new-age coach.

title.children: Diamonds legend worried young netball coaches are getting a watered-down education after Firebirds go through two in a week

image.altText: Joel Amartey of the Swans celebrates a goal with teammate Isaac Heeney, high-fiving and laughing

props.synopsis: Sometimes magic can take place on the football field which no-one expected. Joel Amartey produced that magic which the AFL world sat back and enjoyed.

title.children: Breaking down Joel Amartey's magical nine-goal haul

image.altText: Two investigators speaking near a police car with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: Police arrest a 31-year-old man they believe is linked to a woman's death that caused an emergency declaration that shut down parts of South Mackay.

title.children: Woman shot dead in front of children in Mackay, man who came to her aid remains in hospital

image.altText: A man and a woman embrace in a hospital room.

props.synopsis: After months of being held captive by Hamas, Almog Meir Jan wondered if he'd been forgotten. Then he saw himself on his guards' television.

title.children: Hamas guards told Almog that Israel didn't care about him. Then he saw his face on TV
